docs.snippet: THE Guatemalan case has emphasized the concern of the United States lest communism gain a foothold in the Western Hemisphere. It has at the same time left open the question whether Washington is as much concerned with New World dictatorships of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Guatemalan case has emphasized the concern of the United States lest communism gain a foothold in the Western Hemisphere. It has at the same time left open the question whether Washington is as much concerned with New World dictatorships of the Right as of the Left.
docs.abstract: Fitzgibbons, R H: Uruguay: Portrait of a Democracy

headline.main: A Grand Exemplar of Democracy; URUGUAY: PORTRAIT OF A DEMOCRACY. By Russell H. Fitzgibbon. Illustrated. 301 pp. New Brunswick, N. J.: Rutgers University Press. $5.75.

docs.snippet: GUATEMALA, July 31 -- The President or Guatemala's Junta, Col. Carlos Castillo Armas, said today that his Government, faced with the country's economic needs, is willing to accept economic assistance offered by other countries, especially the United...
docs.lead_paragraph: GUATEMALA, July 31 -- The President or Guatemala's Junta, Col. Carlos Castillo Armas, said today that his Government, faced with the country's economic needs, is willing to accept economic assistance offered by other countries, especially the United States.
docs.abstract: list of 773 persons in diplomatic asylum given to press; Mex Embassy has 306, including Arbenz and Toriello; Castillo charges many criminals sought asylum; hopes for early solution to problem; Liberation Army contingent arrives from Chiquimula

docs.snippet: The Port of New York Authority has completed Portuguese and Spanish-language versions of its film "Via Port of New York," with which it plans to impress on Latin-American shippers the advantages of using this port's vast shipping facilities.

docs.snippet: Softness in the British pound sterling and continued strength in the Canadian dollar highlighted the movements in the foreign exchange market during the past week. Business transacted, though fairly active at times, was only moderate in volume.

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Aug 8 (AP) -- Jerry Barber, who has to remove his glasses to line up short putts, conquered Tam O'Shanter's tricky, rain-dampened greens today for a closing 69 to win the All-American golf title with a 72-hole score of 277 -- eleven under...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Aug 8 (AP) -- Jerry Barber, who has to remove his glasses to line up short putts, conquered Tam O'Shanter's tricky, rain-dampened greens today for a closing 69 to win the All-American golf title with a 72-hole score of 277 -- eleven under par.
docs.abstract: J Barber, Men's All-Amer; Mrs Zaharias, Women's

headline.main: Barber's 277 Takes All-American Golf by a Stroke; Mrs. Zaharias Victor; COAST PRO GETS 69 ON CLOSING ROUND Barber Wins at Chicago With 277 -- Mrs. Zaharias Shoots Record 294 for Victory

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (AP) -- The biggest golf prize in history -- $50,000 cash and a $50,000 exhibition contract -- today was captured by the smallest pro in the game, 127-pound Bob Toski, whose seventy-two-hole total of 274 gave him a one-stroke victory...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (AP) -- The biggest golf prize in history -- $50,000 cash and a $50,000 exhibition contract -- today was captured by the smallest pro in the game, 127-pound Bob Toski, whose seventy-two-hole total of 274 gave him a one-stroke victory in the "world" tournament.
docs.abstract: R Toski, men's tourn, Tarn o'Shanter Club; Berg, women's

headline.main: Toski Takes 'World' Golf Tournament With Card of 274 at Tam o'Shanter; JERSEY PRO POSTS 72 IN FINAL ROUND Toski Scores Over Stewart, Burke by Shot and Wins Prizes Worth $100,000
